title: Puy Lentil Dip

ingredients.content: 2 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil, plus extra for drizzling
30 g red onion, sliced very thinly

preparations.content: Place 700 g water in mixing bowl and heat <b>5 min/100°C/speed 1<b>.
Add lentils and cook <b>20-25 min/98°C//speed 0.5<b> until tender. Drain through a sieve and set aside.
Place butter, tomatoes, oil, garlic and cumin in mixing bowl then chop <b>2 sec/speed 5<b>. Heat <b>2 min/100°C/speed 0.5<b>.
Add 10 g coriander and reserved cooked lentils then cook <b>2 min/100°C/speed 0.5<b>.
Add tahini, lemon juice, remaining 70 g water, salt and pepper then cook <b>5 min/95°C/speed 0.5<b>. Mash <b>3 sec/speed 0.5<b>.

Spread out lentils onto a large, warm serving plate. Scatter over sliced red onion and remaining coriander then drizzle with a little olive oil. Sprinkle over a little paprika and serve warm with flatbreads or pitta.

hintsAndTricks: Check packet instructions for precise cooking time of lentils as they can vary.
This sustaining meal-on-a-plate is a little bit like hummus, though much easier and quicker to prepare. With warm flatbread, serves two as a main, or four as a starter.
Serve with warm boiled eggs to make a more filling meal.
